content:
Here are some examples of words that demonstrate the different types of phonemes:

Vowels:

* /i/ as in "bee"
* /u/ as in "mood"
* /ɑ/ as in "father"
* /ɔ/ as in "bought"
* /ɛ/ as in "bed"
* /ɪ/ as in "bit"
* /æ/ as in "bat"
* /aɪ/ as in "buy"

Stops:

* /p/ as in "pat"
* /b/ as in "bat"
* /t/ as in "tap"
* /d/ as in "dad"
* /k/ as in "cat"
* /g/ as in "go"

Fricatives:

* /f/ as in "fan"
* /v/ as in "van"
* /s/ as in "sun"
* /z/ as in "zoo"
* /h/ as in "hello"
* /ʃ/ as in "she"
* /ʒ/ as in "vision"

Affricates:

* /tʃ/ as in "church"
* /dʒ/ as in "judge"

Nasals:

* /m/ as in "man"
* /n/ as in "no"
* /ŋ/ as in "sing"

Laterals:

* /l/ as in "lake"

It's worth noting that the examples given here are for English language, and different languages use different phonemes and the examples may vary accordingly.
